c74object.name: bach.restrot
c74object.digest: Rotate the negative signs of an llll
c74object.description: Accepts an llll of symbolic durations, and rotates the negative signs through the elements.

objarg.name: shift
objarg.description: Number of steps to rotate the negative signs of. Positive numbers rotate left, negative numbers rotate right.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the rotation on most recently received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set durations llll and output rotated result
method.description: An llll in the first inlet is the list of durations to be rotated. The negative signs are then rotated through the list of a certain amount of steps (set by the shift attribute or by the argument), and the result is output. The elements corresponding to non-negative durations are left untouched.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: shift
attribute.description: Number of steps to rotate the negative signs of. Positive numbers rotate left, negative numbers rotate right.

c74object.discussion: bach.restrot is especially useful to be applied on a list of durations, in order to make rests rotate through a list.
